def: Containing two equivalents of sulphur; as, dithionic acid.Dithionic acid (Chem.), an unstable substance, H2S2O6, known only inits solutions, and in certain well-defined salts.
Serving to exhort; exhortatory; hortative. Barrow.
Resembling a bristle in form; as, a bristle-shaped leaf.

An organic base belonging to the phenylamines. It may beregarded as ammonia in which one hydrogen atom has been replaced bythe radical phenyl. It is a colorless, oily liquid, originallyobtained from indigo by distillation, but now largely manufacturedfrom coal tar or nitrobenzene as a base from which many brilliantdyes are made.

Formerly an allowance of two pounds in every three hundredweight after the tare and tret are subtracted; now used only in ageneral sense, of small deductions from the original weight. [Writtenalso clough.] McCulloch.
The state or quality of being impervious to light; opacity. Dr.H. More.
Giving admonition; instructing by way of caution; warning.Losses, miscarriages, and disappointments, are monitory andinstructive. L'Estrange.
Incapable of being penetrated by balls from firearms.
The quality or state of being rusty.
The act of measuring by paces. [R.] Ash.
The ringdove or wood pigeon.Scarce with cushat's homely song can vie. Sir W. Scott.
